actions.args: {"id": 41, "body": {"name": "Transition of Testnet Validators and near-nodes.io to NEAR One", "summary": "This proposal outlines a plan for NEAR One to take over maintenance and operation of the NEAR Testnet Validators and the near-nodes.io documentation website. The transition would include transferring domain ownership, updating documentation, and ongoing maintenance of testnet validator infrastructure.", "category": "Infrastructure Committee", "timeline": {"status": "APPROVED", "kyc_verified": false, "timeline_version": "V1", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "linked_rfp": null, "supervisor": "trechriron71.near", "description": "NEAR One proposes to assume responsibility for two key components of the NEAR ecosystem:\\\\nTestnet Validators - Maintaining and operating the validator nodes that secure the NEAR testnet network.\\\\nnear-nodes.io - Managing the documentation website that provides critical information on running NEAR nodes.\\\\nThis transition will ensure continued support and development of these important resources as the NEAR ecosystem grows.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n**Approach**\\\\n\\\\nNEAR One will take the following approach:\\\\n* Coordinate with current maintainers to transfer domain ownership and access to near-nodes.io\\\\n* Review and update all documentation on near-nodes.io to ensure accuracy\\\\n* Set up monitoring and maintenance processes for testnet validator nodes\\\\n* Establish a regular update schedule for documentation and validator software\\\\n* Provide technical support to testnet validator operators in main NEAR Validator channels\\\\n\\\\n**Data Integrity**\\\\n\\\\nTo maintain data integrity:\\\\n* All existing documentation will be preserved and version controlled\\\\n* Changes will go through a review process before publication\\\\n* Regular backups of the website and validator data will be performed\\\\n* Strict access controls will be implemented for sensitive systems\\\\n\\\\n**Updates and Changes**\\\\n\\\\nNEAR One will:\\\\n* Provide advance notice of any major changes to the community\\\\n* Solicit feedback on proposed updates through community channels\\\\n* Maintain backwards compatibility where possible\\\\n\\\\n**Usage**\\\\nnear-nodes.io will continue to be accessible public resources for the NEAR community. Usage statistics will be monitored to guide future improvements.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n**Budget**\\\\n\\\\nNEAR One proposes an annual budget of $100,000 to cover:\\\\n* Infrastructure and hosting costs\\\\n* Personnel for maintenance and support\\\\n* Development of new features and improvements\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n**Experience & Portfolio**\\\\n\\\\nNEAR One is a research and development hub focused on NEAR Protocol infrastructure. Our team includes experienced blockchain engineers and researchers with deep expertise in building NEAR and validator operations, documentation, and developer tooling. We have a proven track record of delivering critical infrastructure for the NEAR ecosystem.\\\\n\\\\nBy transitioning these resources to NEAR One, we can leverage our technical capabilities to ensure their continued growth and improvement in service of the NEAR community\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "woben.near", "requested_sponsor": "infrastructure-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V1", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "100000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Other"]}

{"body": {"name": "Upgrade, Expand and Decentralise NEAR\\\\u{2019}s RPC Infrastructure with Liquify", "summary": "Liquify proposes to upgrade NEAR\\\\\\'s RPC infrastructure with a hybrid strategy, combining high-performance bare-metal servers with greater access to decentralized RPC protocols. Key points:\\\\n\\\\n- Already served 14B NEAR requests (99.999% success)\\\\n- Support decentralized infra protocols (LAVA, POKT, SubQuery etc.) with an industry leading infra backbone\\\\n- Mainnet & Testnet (archival included) \\\\n- Developer portal w/ free-tier & SLA support\\\\n- Global coverage w/ fully owned hardware (not rented or cloud)", "category": "Infrastructure Committee", "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "linked_rfp": 2, "description": "# 1. Submission Info\\\\n\\\\nSubmitted By:  Liquify LTD\\\\n\\\\n- Name: Shane Burgett\\\\n- Role: Account Lead\\\\n- Email: shane@liquify.io\\\\n- Telegram: [shane8burger](https://dev.near.org/infrastructure-committee.near/widget/app?page=create-proposal&rfp_id=2#/mob.near/widget/ProfilePage?accountId=shane8burger)\\\\n\\\\nDate:  October 3, 2024\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n# 2. Executive Summary\\\\n\\\\n**Overview**\\\\nAs the NEAR ecosystem grows, it requires a scalable, resilient RPC infrastructure that balances performance and decentralisation. **Liquify is uniquely positioned to meet this need with a bridge solution that combines the performance of centralised infrastructure with the greater access and resiliency of decentralisation through our involvement in decentralised RPC protocols.** Our globally distributed, fully-owned bare-metal infrastructure ensures high performance and reliability while supporting NEAR\\\\\\'s goal of broader, decentralised access.\\\\n  \\\\n**Key Objectives**\\\\n\\\\n- Seamless transition and management of NEAR\\\\\\'s existing RPC infrastructure.\\\\n- High-performance and reliable RPC services that exceed NEAR\\\\\\'s stated goals.\\\\n- Flexible, scalable infrastructure to support NEAR\\\\\\'s growth and exposes NEAR to numerous decentralised infrastructure protocols.\\\\n- Developer Portal\\\\n\\\\nValue Proposition  \\\\nLiquify\\\\\\'s hybrid approach blends the performance of centralised services with the decentralised ethos of blockchain. Our proven expertise in managing complex infrastructures makes us the ideal partner to support NEAR\\\\\\'s vision for a decentralised, scalable future.\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n# 3. Organisation Information\\\\n\\\\n**Size of the Team**\\\\n\\\\n- Total Employees: 15+ team members.\\\\n- Engineering Team: 9+ engineers with extensive experience in blockchain infrastructure and RPC services.\\\\n\\\\n**Team Location**\\\\n\\\\n- Headquarters in the UK.\\\\n- Data centres in the US (Phoenix, Washington D.C.), Europe (Germany, UK), and Asia (Singapore, Japan) to provide comprehensive global coverage.\\\\n\\\\n**Team Background and Bios**\\\\n\\\\n- Andy Pohl: CEO with a strong background in software engineering and extensive experience in blockchain infrastructure. Andy has a Master\\\\\\'s in Electronic & Computer Engineering from the University of Birmingham and has previously worked with leading blockchain projects.\\\\n- Isaac Rodgin: Head of Business Development with a robust background in integrating custom infrastructure solutions for web3 projects and investment firms. Founder of Rodgin Consulting Group and former advisor at Fuse.io.\\\\n- Shane Burgett: Account Lead with a strong focus on blockchain infrastructure, having served as Product Lead at Pocket Network Foundation and founded Decentralized Authority, an infrastructure tooling devshop.\\\\n\\\\n**Affiliations with NEAR Ecosystem Partners**\\\\nLiquify has had much involvement with NEAR, providing RPC and node services to various ecosystem participants, including Aurora, POKT Network, Lava Network, dRPC, Subquery, and TRGC.\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n# 4. Professional Experience\\\\n\\\\n**Relevant Experience with NEAR Blockchain**\\\\n\\\\n- Liquify has been a trusted infrastructure provider for NEAR, serving over **14 billions NEAR RPC requests** acrossing full nodes, archival nodes, and indexing, with a success rate of 99.9998%.\\\\n- Our team has worked directly with the Pagoda team and familiar with all of NEAR\\\\\\'s tooling.\\\\n- We are familiar with NEAR upgrades and were able to maintain reliability during the Q2 resharding events.\\\\n- We have brought critical NEAR infrastructure to multiple decentralised infrastructure protocols, like LAVA, POKT, and dRPC.\\\\n- Liquify is also heavily involved with NEAR validation with current delegations equating to $30M+ of staked NEAR tokens.\\\\n\\\\n**Non-Technical Capabilities**\\\\n\\\\n- Product Management: We assign dedicated product managers to each engagement, ensuring effective communication and timely delivery.\\\\n- Customer Support: Liquify provides 24/7 support through multiple channels, including Slack, Telegram, Discord, and email.\\\\n- Business Development and Marketing: We focus on building long-term relationships with institutional clients and blockchain ecosystems through tailored solutions and strategic partnerships.\\\\n\\\\n**In-House Resources**\\\\n\\\\n- Design UX/UI: Our design team specialises in creating custom applications and dashboards for monitoring RPC performance and network status.\\\\n- Customer Support: A dedicated team ensures prompt resolution of any technical issues, with a focus on providing a seamless user experience.\\\\n\\\\n**Portfolio of Relevant Work**\\\\n\\\\nLiquify has a long history of delivering on foundation partnership and public proposals:\\\\n\\\\n- POKT validation, snapshots, RPC infra, and RPC Gateway: [Public Proposal](https://forum.pokt.network/t/open-priority-gateway-demo/4874/2) \\\\u{2192} [Launched Product](https://www.liquify.com/blog/pokt-network-is-getting-a-new-gateway-by-liquify)\\\\n- Selfchain RPC infra, IBC relayer, and validator: [Foundation Partnership](https://x.com/selfchainxyz/status/1806251581186379816)\\\\n- Subquery validator and RPC infra: [Foundation Partnership](https://x.com/Liquify_ltd/status/1801260253809692689)\\\\n- Stellar RPC infra: [Public Proposal](https://communityfund.stellar.org/project/infrastructure-support-liquify)\\\\n- Syscoin RPC infra: [Foundation Partnership](https://rollux.com/news/weekly-240426)\\\\n- Fuse RPC Infra: [Foundation Partnership](https://news.fuse.io/liquify-powers-up-to-provide-fuse-network-rpc-nodes/)\\\\n- Pyth Network Publisher infra & Hermes provider: Foundation Partnership\\\\n- Sentinel public RPC infra and validator: Foundation Partnership\\\\n- Infura\\\\\\'s DIN (Liquify is the leading provider): [Public Partnership](https://www.infura.io/solutions/decentralized-infrastructure-service)\\\\n\\\\nLiquify also is a central player in numerous decentralised RPC protocols:\\\\n\\\\n- LAVA\\\\n- POKT\\\\n- DIN - Infura\\\\\\'s Decentralised Infrastructure Network\\\\n- dRPC\\\\n- Route Protocol\\\\n- Subquery\\\\n\\\\n# 5. Approach and Solution\\\\n  \\\\n\\\\n### Primary Approach and Solution\\\\n\\\\nLiquify will utilise a three-pronged strategy to address NEAR\\\\\\'s RPC infrastructure needs:\\\\n\\\\n1. Delivering Top-Tier Performance through Bare-Metal Infrastructure: Liquify will provide the fastest, most distributed, and highly reliable bare-metal infrastructure. This ensures industry-leading performance, capable of supporting NEAR\\\\\\'s expanding ecosystem with the highest levels of uptime, low latency, and optimised traffic management. This infrastructure will be a mix of nodes and indexing (likely [Read RPC](https://github.com/near/read-rpc/))\\\\n\\\\n2. Empowering NEAR with a Robust Developer Portal: Liquify will establish an industry-leading RPC portal for NEAR developers. This portal will feature an accessible free tier, simplified billing, robust monitoring, notifications, and comprehensive Service Level Agreement (SLA) assurances. In addition, developers will benefit from decentralised RPC protocol access, allowing for seamless interaction with NEAR\\\\\\'s network through a decentralised approach.\\\\n\\\\n3. Bridging NEAR to Decentralised Infrastructure Protocols: Liquify will strategically position NEAR within the decentralised infrastructure protocol landscape by integrating multiple RPC gateway options. This approach ensures that NEAR developers can access both centralised and decentralised RPC services, empowering them with the flexibility to choose the best infrastructure for their specific use case.\\\\n\\\\n### Why Choose Liquify\\\\n\\\\nLiquify is uniquely positioned to accelerate NEAR\\\\\\'s developer experience by offering a balanced solution that addresses both centralised and decentralised needs. NEAR should not be limited to a single RPC infrastructure solution. Liquify\\\\\\'s platform offers a variety of RPC experiences to cater to the diverse requirements of different projects and developers within the NEAR ecosystem.\\\\n  \\\\nWith proven experience and a long-standing relationship with NEAR, Liquify can ensure a seamless transition from NEAR\\\\\\'s current RPC setup while introducing improvements in performance, decentralisation, and flexibility. This combination makes Liquify the optimal partner to lead NEAR\\\\\\'s infrastructure into the future.\\\\n  \\\\n**Open Source and Licensing**\\\\nAll software developed as part of this project will be released under Apache 2.0 or MIT licences, fostering community collaboration and transparency.\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n# 6. Multi-Gateway Decentralisation\\\\n\\\\nWith Liquify providing the foundational infrastructure layer for decentralised RPC protocols, NEAR can be widely supported on numerous gateways. This would be the first time NEAR would have full support, including archival, on these protocols.\\\\n\\\\nBy enabling NEAR on these RPC protocols, NEAR developers will have multiple gateway options, providing unique UXs, payment methods, and pricing structures. NEAR developers do not have to be locked into any single gateway.  \\\\nLiquify enables NEAR to have true decentralisation and gateway choice.\\\\n\\\\n![Multi-Gateway Decentralisation](https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreigjuyw2l7jinng7jqoz4xwaj3k5zi55sncpy2bkdbmz3bhzhygwie)\\\\n\\\\n- *Liquify Gateway - [https://www.liquify.com/](https://www.liquify.com/)*\\\\n\\\\n![LAVA Gateway](https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreiauqtvn5kbkrdcndb7nbizujqz5bqakmg54zr33uofbh4gvvuk5j4)\\\\n\\\\n- *LAVA Gateway - [https://gateway.lavanet.xyz/](https://gateway.lavanet.xyz/)*\\\\n\\\\n![Grove Gateway](https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreidffuv3wweqdkqxs4t4iefcglcpemzocjlo7zkdjlghzmeo6jixqi)\\\\n\\\\n- *Grove Gateway (powered by POKT) - [https://grove.city](https://grove.city/)*\\\\n\\\\n![dRPC Gateway](https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreidyprzevqvnutwe3h7fpn57t5fudhyb5p277dvfbdwgjawmp2jhkm)\\\\n\\\\n- *dRPC Gateway - [https://drpc.org/](https://drpc.org/)*\\\\n\\\\n# 7. Goals / Milestones\\\\n\\\\n**Goal 1: Transition Planning and Knowledge Transfer**  \\\\n*Completion by November 1, 2024*\\\\n\\\\n- Conduct workshops with Pagoda and NEAR teams to outline the transition strategy.\\\\n- Develop a comprehensive knowledge transfer document detailing the current infrastructure setup.\\\\n- Help test with the community focused on snapshot repair\\\\n\\\\n**Goal 2: Infrastructure Deployment**  \\\\n*Completion by December 1, 2024*\\\\n\\\\n- Deploy Liquify\\\\\\'s infrastructure for NEAR mainnet and testnet RPC services.\\\\n- Begin deployment of NEAR Archival across the globe in collaboration with the community focused on snapshot repair.\\\\n- Implement rate-limited free-tier services for developers.\\\\n- Share initial performance report.\\\\n- Fully support NEAR on supported decentralised infrastructure protocols\\\\n\\\\n**Goal 3: Performance Optimization and SLA Implementation**  \\\\n*Completion by February 1, 2024*\\\\n\\\\n- Launch Liquify\\\\\\'s NEAR portal\\\\n- Optimise infrastructure performance and implement the SLA.\\\\n- Establish external status pages and alerting systems for real-time monitoring.\\\\n\\\\n**Goal 4: Community Engagement + Enchanced Decentralization**  \\\\n*Completion by March 1, 2025*\\\\n\\\\n- Engage the developer community through workshops and/or webinars.\\\\n- Advocate for increased NEAR exposure on existing and future decentralised infrastructure protocols\\\\n\\\\n# 8. Metrics\\\\n\\\\n**Key Metrics for Success**\\\\n\\\\n- Uptime and Performance: Achieving 99.95% uptime and sub-200ms response time for mainnet RPC.\\\\n- User Adoption: Number of developers and dApps using the Liquify RPC portal, and seeing NEAR continually supported on decentralised protocols LAVA, POKT and possibly others.\\\\n- Community Engagement: Participation in workshops and feedback from NEAR developers.\\\\n\\\\n**Measurement Plan**\\\\n\\\\n- Continuous monitoring through Liquify\\\\\\'s dashboard and other protocols.\\\\n- Monthly reports to the NEAR Foundation on SLA compliance, user adoption, and community feedback.\\\\n\\\\n# 9. Competitor Comparison\\\\n\\\\n**Competitor Analysis**\\\\n  \\\\n- **Standard Providers:** Most RPC services rely on the cloud or hardware rental services for their infrastructure, making deployment significantly more challenging when trying to establish world coverage. These providers are subject to changing rental costs, hardware availability, usage agreements, etc. Liquify is unique in it owns all of their hardware, ensuring complete global coverage of our services.\\\\n- **Decentralised Providers:** While they align with the ethos of decentralisation, they often struggle with performance and reliability issues due to fragmented infrastructure.\\\\n\\\\n**Unique Value Proposition**  \\\\nLiquify bridges the gap between these two models, providing a hybrid solution that combines the high performance and reliability of centralised infrastructure with the resilience and decentralisation of protocols. This makes us uniquely capable of supporting NEAR\\\\\\'s needs as it transitions to a more decentralised future.\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n# 10. Usage & Examples\\\\n\\\\n**Current Users**\\\\n\\\\n- Infura: Liquify serves as the primary backup infrastructure to Infura, serving the lion share of all requests going through [DIN](https://www.infura.io/solutions/decentralized-infrastructure-service) due to our response times and reliability.\\\\n- Defi Kingdoms: Liquify\\\\\\'s infrastructure successfully managed over 1 billion RPC requests a day with minimal latency and a 99.9999% success rate.\\\\n- TRGC: Supported their portfolio companies with efficient, cost-effective infrastructure solutions, demonstrating our ability to handle mission-critical systems.\\\\n\\\\n**Potential Use Cases**\\\\n\\\\n- NEAR developers that require stable and high-performance RPC access, with a user experience similar to other ecosystems.\\\\n- dApps wanting a true decentralised experience through decentralised RPC protocols, knowing that Liquify is providing a reliable, fast, core infrastructure.\\\\n\\\\n**Scalability Examples**  \\\\nLiquify has demonstrated the ability to scale infrastructure to handle up to 200,000 requests per minute, far exceeding NEAR\\\\\\'s current traffic requirements. We have consistently delivered high-quality, high-performance RPC services, supporting 60+ chains, including NEAR, to customers directly or through decentralised RPC protocols. This scalability will support NEAR\\\\\\'s growth and ensure reliable service for developers and users.\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n# 11. Budget\\\\n\\\\n**Inititial Budget: $171,000 for the first 6 months.**\\\\n\\\\n- Initial Setup and On-boarding: $8,500 (October 2024)\\\\n  - Deploying full nodes, archival nodes, indexes, and setting up support infrastructure.\\\\n- Community Reward: $12,500 for the community members assisting with archival snapshot repair.\\\\n- Monthly Maintenance: $35,000/month (November 2024 - March 2025)\\\\n  - Infrastructure cost, maintenance, and network upgrades.\\\\n  - Free-tier traffic coverage\\\\n  - Customer support\\\\n\\\\n**Renewal Budget: $150,000 for the next 6 months.**\\\\n\\\\n- Monthly Maintenance: $35,000/month (April 2025 - September 2025)\\\\n  - Infrastructure cost, maintenance, and network upgrades.\\\\n  - Free-tier traffic coverage\\\\n  - Customer support\\\\n\\\\n# 12. Security and Compliance\\\\n\\\\n**Security Measures**\\\\n\\\\n- Comprehensive DDoS protection, IP whitelisting, and detailed logging and monitoring.\\\\n- Custom tools for disaster recovery and incident management, ensuring high availability and resilience.\\\\n- Leading EDR software running on all our hosts\\\\n\\\\n**Disaster Recovery Plan**\\\\n\\\\n- Regular backups and a robust disaster recovery protocol ensure service continuity and data integrity, with the ability to recover from any disruptions quickly and efficiently.\\\\n\\\\n**Compliance and Data Integrity**\\\\n\\\\n- Adherence to NEAR\\\\\\'s data consistency requirements and transparent communication of any service disruptions or changes. Liquify commits to providing a secure and compliant infrastructure that aligns with NEAR\\\\\\'s operational standards.\\\\n\\\\n# 13. Service Level Agreement (SLA)\\\\n\\\\n**Uptime Guarantee:**  \\\\n99.95% monthly uptime, ensuring minimal service interruptions and maintaining the high availability of NEAR\\\\\\'s RPC services.\\\\n\\\\n**Performance Standards** *\\\\n\\\\n- Mainnet RPC: Average response time \\\\u{2264} 200 milliseconds.\\\\n- Testnet RPC: Average response time \\\\u{2264} 200 milliseconds.\\\\n- Archival-RPC: Average response time \\\\u{2264} 500 milliseconds.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\\\\\* From calls within EU, US and APAC\\\\n\\\\n**Throughput**\\\\n\\\\n- RPC Mainnet: Peak spike of 20k per/s\\\\n- RPC-Archival Mainnet: Peak spike of 5k per/s\\\\n- RPC Testnet: Peak spikes of 1k requests/s\\\\n- RPC-Archival Testnet: Peak spikes of 500 requests/s\\\\n\\\\n**Support Availability**\\\\n\\\\n- Community-based support with best-effort responses within 24-48 hours for generic services, ensuring quick and efficient resolution of issues.\\\\n\\\\n# 14. Support and Maintenance\\\\n\\\\n**Community Support**\\\\n\\\\n- Dedicated support channels on Slack, Telegram, and Discord for developer assistance and issue resolution.\\\\n- Regular updates and bug fixes based on community feedback, ensuring a responsive and engaged support experience.\\\\n\\\\n**Ongoing Maintenance**\\\\n\\\\n- Continuous infrastructure monitoring and optimization, with regular collaboration with NEAR developers for client improvements and upgrades.\\\\n- Monthly performance reviews and reports to the NEAR Foundation, ensuring transparency and accountability.\\\\n\\\\n# 15. Governance and Compliance\\\\n\\\\n**Governance Structure**\\\\n\\\\n- Defined roles and responsibilities within the Liquify team for project management, technical leadership, and customer support, ensuring clear accountability and effective decision-making.\\\\n- Regular communication and reporting to NEAR stakeholders to maintain transparency and alignment with NEAR\\\\\\'s goals.\\\\n\\\\n**Reporting**\\\\n\\\\n- Monthly progress reports to the NEAR Foundation, including updates on project milestones, SLA compliance, and community engagement.\\\\n- Transparent communication of any changes or updates to the project plan, ensuring that all stakeholders are informed and aligned.\\\\n\\\\n# 16. Conclusion\\\\n\\\\nLiquify\\\\\\'s unique combination of high-performance, centralised service quality and decentralised resilience makes us the ideal partner for managing NEAR\\\\\\'s RPC infrastructure. Our fully-owned bare-metal infrastructure, extensive experience with the NEAR ecosystem, and commitment to decentralisation position us to provide a scalable, reliable, and future-proof solution.\\\\n  \\\\nWe invite the NEAR Foundation to collaborate with Liquify in transitioning and enhancing the current RPC infrastructure. Together, we can ensure that the NEAR ecosystem continues to grow and thrive with a robust, decentralised infrastructure that supports its long-term vision and goals.", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "liquify.near", "requested_sponsor": "infrastructure-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V1", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "321000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": []}

Approach and Solution\\\\n  \\\\n\\\\n### Primary Approach and Solution\\\\n\\\\nLiquify will utilise a three-pronged strategy to address NEAR\\\\\\'s RPC infrastructure needs:\\\\n\\\\n1. Delivering Top-Tier Performance through Bare-Metal Infrastructure: Liquify will provide the fastest, most distributed, and highly reliable bare-metal infrastructure. This ensures industry-leading performance, capable of supporting NEAR\\\\\\'s expanding ecosystem with the highest levels of uptime, low latency, and optimised traffic management. This infrastructure will be a mix of nodes and indexing (likely [Read RPC](https://github.com/near/read-rpc/))\\\\n\\\\n2. Empowering NEAR with a Robust Developer Portal: Liquify will establish an industry-leading RPC portal for NEAR developers. This portal will feature an accessible free tier, simplified billing, robust monitoring, notifications, and comprehensive Service Level Agreement (SLA) assurances. In addition, developers will benefit from decentralised RPC protocol access, allowing for seamless interaction with NEAR\\\\\\'s network through a decentralised approach.\\\\n\\\\n3. Bridging NEAR to Decentralised Infrastructure Protocols: Liquify will strategically position NEAR within the decentralised infrastructure protocol landscape by integrating multiple RPC gateway options. This approach ensures that NEAR developers can access both centralised and decentralised RPC services, empowering them with the flexibility to choose the best infrastructure for their specific use case.\\\\n\\\\n### Why Choose Liquify\\\\n\\\\nLiquify is uniquely positioned to accelerate NEAR\\\\\\'s developer experience by offering a balanced solution that addresses both centralised and decentralised needs. NEAR should not be limited to a single RPC infrastructure solution. Liquify\\\\\\'s platform offers a variety of RPC experiences to cater to the diverse requirements of different projects and developers within the NEAR ecosystem.\\\\n  \\\\nWith proven experience and a long-standing relationship with NEAR, Liquify can ensure a seamless transition from NEAR\\\\\\'s current RPC setup while introducing improvements in performance, decentralisation, and flexibility. This combination makes Liquify the optimal partner to lead NEAR\\\\\\'s infrastructure into the future.\\\\n  \\\\n**Open Source and Licensing**\\\\nAll software developed as part of this project will be released under Apache 2.0 or MIT licences, fostering community collaboration and transparency.\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n# 6. Multi-Gateway Decentralisation\\\\n\\\\nWith Liquify providing the foundational infrastructure layer for decentralised RPC protocols, NEAR can be widely supported on numerous gateways. This would be the first time NEAR would have full support, including archival, on these protocols.\\\\n\\\\nBy enabling NEAR on these RPC protocols, NEAR developers will have multiple gateway options, providing unique UXs, payment methods, and pricing structures. NEAR developers do not have to be locked into any single gateway.  \\\\nLiquify enables NEAR to have true decentralisation and gateway choice.\\\\n\\\\n![Multi-Gateway Decentralisation](https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreigjuyw2l7jinng7jqoz4xwaj3k5zi55sncpy2bkdbmz3bhzhygwie)\\\\n\\\\n- *Liquify Gateway - [https://www.liquify.com/](https://www.liquify.com/)*\\\\n\\\\n![LAVA Gateway](https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreiauqtvn5kbkrdcndb7nbizujqz5bqakmg54zr33uofbh4gvvuk5j4)\\\\n\\\\n- *LAVA Gateway - [https://gateway.lavanet.xyz/](https://gateway.lavanet.xyz/)*\\\\n\\\\n![Grove Gateway](https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreidffuv3wweqdkqxs4t4iefcglcpemzocjlo7zkdjlghzmeo6jixqi)\\\\n\\\\n- *Grove Gateway (powered by POKT) - [https://grove.city](https://grove.city/)*\\\\n\\\\n![dRPC Gateway](https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreidyprzevqvnutwe3h7fpn57t5fudhyb5p277dvfbdwgjawmp2jhkm)\\\\n\\\\n- *dRPC Gateway - [https://drpc.org/](https://drpc.org/)*\\\\n\\\\n# 7. Goals / Milestones\\\\n\\\\n**Goal 1: Transition Planning and Knowledge Transfer**  \\\\n*Completion by November 1, 2024*\\\\n\\\\n- Conduct workshops with Pagoda and NEAR teams to outline the transition strategy.\\\\n- Develop a comprehensive knowledge transfer document detailing the current infrastructure setup.\\\\n- Help test with the community focused on snapshot repair\\\\n\\\\n**Goal 2: Infrastructure Deployment**  \\\\n*Completion by December 1, 2024*\\\\n\\\\n- Deploy Liquify\\\\\\'s infrastructure for NEAR mainnet and testnet RPC services.\\\\n- Begin deployment of NEAR Archival across the globe in collaboration with the community focused on snapshot repair.\\\\n- Implement rate-limited free-tier services for developers.\\\\n- Share initial performance report.\\\\n- Fully support NEAR on supported decentralised infrastructure protocols\\\\n\\\\n**Goal 3: Performance Optimization and SLA Implementation**  \\\\n*Completion by February 1, 2024*\\\\n\\\\n- Launch Liquify\\\\\\'s NEAR portal\\\\n- Optimise infrastructure performance and implement the SLA.\\\\n- Establish external status pages and alerting systems for real-time monitoring.\\\\n\\\\n**Goal 4: Community Engagement + Enchanced Decentralization**  \\\\n*Completion by March 1, 2025*\\\\n\\\\n- Engage the developer community through workshops and/or webinars.\\\\n- Advocate for increased NEAR exposure on existing and future decentralised infrastructure protocols\\\\n\\\\n# 8. Metrics\\\\n\\\\n**Key Metrics for Success**\\\\n\\\\n- Uptime and Performance: Achieving 99.95% uptime and sub-200ms response time for mainnet RPC.\\\\n- User Adoption: Number of developers and dApps using the Liquify RPC portal, and seeing NEAR continually supported on decentralised protocols LAVA, POKT and possibly others.\\\\n- Community Engagement: Participation in workshops and feedback from NEAR developers.\\\\n\\\\n**Measurement Plan**\\\\n\\\\n- Continuous monitoring through Liquify\\\\\\'s dashboard and other protocols.\\\\n- Monthly reports to the NEAR Foundation on SLA compliance, user adoption, and community feedback.\\\\n\\\\n# 9. Competitor Comparison\\\\n\\\\n**Competitor Analysis**\\\\n  \\\\n- **Standard Providers:** Most RPC services rely on the cloud or hardware rental services for their infrastructure, making deployment significantly more challenging when trying to establish world coverage. These providers are subject to changing rental costs, hardware availability, usage agreements, etc. Liquify is unique in it owns all of their hardware, ensuring complete global coverage of our services.\\\\n- **Decentralised Providers:** While they align with the ethos of decentralisation, they often struggle with performance and reliability issues due to fragmented infrastructure.\\\\n\\\\n**Unique Value Proposition**  \\\\nLiquify bridges the gap between these two models, providing a hybrid solution that combines the high performance and reliability of centralised infrastructure with the resilience and decentralisation of protocols. This makes us uniquely capable of supporting NEAR\\\\\\'s needs as it transitions to a more decentralised future.\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n# 10. Usage & Examples\\\\n\\\\n**Current Users**\\\\n\\\\n- Infura: Liquify serves as the primary backup infrastructure to Infura, serving the lion share of all requests going through [DIN](https://www.infura.io/solutions/decentralized-infrastructure-service) due to our response times and reliability.\\\\n- Defi Kingdoms: Liquify\\\\\\'s infrastructure successfully managed over 1 billion RPC requests a day with minimal latency and a 99.9999% success rate.\\\\n- TRGC: Supported their portfolio companies with efficient, cost-effective infrastructure solutions, demonstrating our ability to handle mission-critical systems.\\\\n\\\\n**Potential Use Cases**\\\\n\\\\n- NEAR developers that require stable and high-performance RPC access, with a user experience similar to other ecosystems.\\\\n- dApps wanting a true decentralised experience through decentralised RPC protocols, knowing that Liquify is providing a reliable, fast, core infrastructure.\\\\n\\\\n**Scalability Examples**  \\\\nLiquify has demonstrated the ability to scale infrastructure to handle up to 200,000 requests per minute, far exceeding NEAR\\\\\\'s current traffic requirements. We have consistently delivered high-quality, high-performance RPC services, supporting 60+ chains, including NEAR, to customers directly or through decentralised RPC protocols. This scalability will support NEAR\\\\\\'s growth and ensure reliable service for developers and users.\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n# 11. Budget\\\\n\\\\n**Inititial Budget: $171,000 for the first 6 months.**\\\\n\\\\n- Initial Setup and On-boarding: $8,500 (October 2024)\\\\n  - Deploying full nodes, archival nodes, indexes, and setting up support infrastructure.\\\\n- Community Reward: $12,500 for the community members assisting with archival snapshot repair.\\\\n- Monthly Maintenance: $35,000/month (November 2024 - March 2025)\\\\n  - Infrastructure cost, maintenance, and network upgrades.\\\\n  - Free-tier traffic coverage\\\\n  - Customer support\\\\n\\\\n**Renewal Budget: $150,000 for the next 6 months.**\\\\n\\\\n- Monthly Maintenance: $35,000/month (April 2025 - September 2025)\\\\n  - Infrastructure cost, maintenance, and network upgrades.\\\\n  - Free-tier traffic coverage\\\\n  - Customer support\\\\n\\\\n# 12. Security and Compliance\\\\n\\\\n**Security Measures**\\\\n\\\\n- Comprehensive DDoS protection, IP whitelisting, and detailed logging and monitoring.\\\\n- Custom tools for disaster recovery and incident management, ensuring high availability and resilience.\\\\n- Leading EDR software running on all our hosts\\\\n\\\\n**Disaster Recovery Plan**\\\\n\\\\n- Regular backups and a robust disaster recovery protocol ensure service continuity and data integrity, with the ability to recover from any disruptions quickly and efficiently.\\\\n\\\\n**Compliance and Data Integrity**\\\\n\\\\n- Adherence to NEAR\\\\\\'s data consistency requirements and transparent communication of any service disruptions or changes. Liquify commits to providing a secure and compliant infrastructure that aligns with NEAR\\\\\\'s operational standards.\\\\n\\\\n# 13. Service Level Agreement (SLA)\\\\n\\\\n**Uptime Guarantee:**  \\\\n99.95% monthly uptime, ensuring minimal service interruptions and maintaining the high availability of NEAR\\\\\\'s RPC services.\\\\n\\\\n**Performance Standards** *\\\\n\\\\n- Mainnet RPC: Average response time \\\\u{2264} 200 milliseconds.\\\\n- Testnet RPC: Average response time \\\\u{2264} 200 milliseconds.\\\\n- Archival-RPC: Average response time \\\\u{2264} 500 milliseconds.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\\\\\* From calls within EU, US and APAC\\\\n\\\\n**Throughput**\\\\n\\\\n- RPC Mainnet: Peak spike of 20k per/s\\\\n- RPC-Archival Mainnet: Peak spike of 5k per/s\\\\n- RPC Testnet: Peak spikes of 1k requests/s\\\\n- RPC-Archival Testnet: Peak spikes of 500 requests/s\\\\n\\\\n**Support Availability**\\\\n\\\\n- Community-based support with best-effort responses within 24-48 hours for generic services, ensuring quick and efficient resolution of issues.\\\\n\\\\n# 14. Support and Maintenance\\\\n\\\\n**Community Support**\\\\n\\\\n- Dedicated support channels on Slack, Telegram, and Discord for developer assistance and issue resolution.\\\\n- Regular updates and bug fixes based on community feedback, ensuring a responsive and engaged support experience.\\\\n\\\\n**Ongoing Maintenance**\\\\n\\\\n- Continuous infrastructure monitoring and optimization, with regular collaboration with NEAR developers for client improvements and upgrades.\\\\n- Monthly performance reviews and reports to the NEAR Foundation, ensuring transparency and accountability.\\\\n\\\\n# 15. Governance and Compliance\\\\n\\\\n**Governance Structure**\\\\n\\\\n- Defined roles and responsibilities within the Liquify team for project management, technical leadership, and customer support, ensuring clear accountability and effective decision-making.\\\\n- Regular communication and reporting to NEAR stakeholders to maintain transparency and alignment with NEAR\\\\\\'s goals.\\\\n\\\\n**Reporting**\\\\n\\\\n- Monthly progress reports to the NEAR Foundation, including updates on project milestones, SLA compliance, and community engagement.\\\\n- Transparent communication of any changes or updates to the project plan, ensuring that all stakeholders are informed and aligned.\\\\n\\\\n# 16. Conclusion\\\\n\\\\nLiquify\\\\\\'s unique combination of high-performance, centralised service quality and decentralised resilience makes us the ideal partner for managing NEAR\\\\\\'s RPC infrastructure. Our fully-owned bare-metal infrastructure, extensive experience with the NEAR ecosystem, and commitment to decentralisation position us to provide a scalable, reliable, and future-proof solution.\\\\n  \\\\nWe invite the NEAR Foundation to collaborate with Liquify in transitioning and enhancing the current RPC infrastructure. Together, we can ensure that the NEAR ecosystem continues to grow and thrive with a robust, decentralised infrastructure that supports its long-term vision and goals.", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "liquify.near", "requested_sponsor": "infrastructure-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V1", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "321000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "author_id": "shane0.near", "snapshot_history": [], "social_db_post_block_height": "0"}}

{"id": 30, "body": {"name": "Intear on-chain events API", "summary": "Intear\\\\\\'s most popular product is a telegram bot with notifications about various on-chain events - https://t.me/bettearbot. Our indexers and APIs have been open-source from the beginning, but the APIs are not production-ready yet. This proposal focuses on polishing the APIs to enable developers to gather on-chain events more easily, without a heavy backend and writing their own indexers, and improving Tearbot, our free bot with notifications, that will soon have block explorer capabilities.", "category": "Infrastructure Committee", "timeline": {"status": "APPROVED", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "linked_rfp": null, "supervisor": "trechriron71.near", "description": "## Organization\\\\n\\\\nIntear\\\\n\\\\n### Primary person\\\\u{2019}s contact information\\\\n\\\\nVolodymyr Malanchuk, slime@intear.tech, https://t.me/slimytentacles\\\\n\\\\n### Size of the whole team\\\\n\\\\n6\\\\n\\\\n### Size of the engineering team\\\\n\\\\n2 (but only 1 will be working on the projects mentioned in this proposal)\\\\n\\\\n### Team location\\\\n\\\\nRemote\\\\n\\\\n### Team background and bios\\\\n\\\\nWe started as a memecoin, but after looking at similar projects on other chains, we realized that there is a gap in memecoin tooling - no free telegram bot that sends notifications in a group when someone buys a token, so we built a bot and that has its own indexer. Then found another gap - a tip bot that can send arbitrary tokens, not just near, and is easy to connect, and have been adding more functionality ever since. During TPS spikes caused by HOT Wallet events, the bot stopped working, as well as, dexscreener, near.org RPCs, and some of the other indexers, so we decided to rewrite the bot from scratch with performance, scalability, and fault tolerance in mind, and eventually decided to create public APIs for anyone to use the infrastructure that powers our new bot. The main developer (Slime) has been developing games for 7 years, joined crypto in early 2022 and Near in December 2023. Github: https://github.com/Sliman4\\\\n\\\\n### Any affiliations with other NEAR ecosystem partners?\\\\n\\\\nWe\\\\\\'re in some way connected to a big chunk of the ecosystem, but our closest partnership is with Shitzu. A modified version of our tip bot is used in Shitzu Boost, one of the biggest marketing initiatives used by NEAR ecosystem, our bot had meme.cooking \\\\\\\"virtual tokens\\\\\\\" support on the same time as meme.cooking launched, and we\\\\\\'re actively discussing building new things together.\\\\n\\\\nNot really affiliations, but I think it\\\\\\'s worth mentioning that we have the most popular and our telegram bot is used by almost all NEAR projects, particularly memecoins but also a lot of development chats like NEAR Dev, and general-audience chats like NEAR Protocol Official, Meteor Russian, and many more. Regarding unrelated to infra, we used to participate in Ref Finance\\\\\\'s Meme Season event and Shitzu\\\\\\'s memecoin index until recently (we\\\\\\'re going to freeze our token soon), are participating in TextRoyale tournament (game that uses Bitte Wallet in telegram), joining development initiatives such as building a [Bitte Agent](https://wallet.bitte.ai/smart-actions/prompt/how%20can%20you%20assist%20me%3F?mode=debug&agentId=tokens-agent.intear.tech) that fetches price data from prices.intear.tech, [MoreTPS leaderboard](https://tps.intear.tech/?round=beta.moretps.near) that uses a custom indexer and Intear APIs, and have many unannounced collabs with tech projects in the ecosystem, and among the most recent ones, will probably help the ecosystem [be a safer place](https://t.me/neardev/57416).\\\\n\\\\n## Professional Experience\\\\n\\\\n@slimedragon.near worked as a freelancer for ~7 years, mostly making Minecraft plugins, sometimes tried starting own projects. One of the crypto-related projects was [WalletConnectMC](https://github.com/CraftToken/WalletConnectMC) which provided a decentralized and frictionless connection, and optional wallet-less onboarding.\\\\n\\\\n### Examples of relevant experience with NEAR blockchain\\\\n\\\\nhttps://github.com/INTEARnear/ has a lot of repos with NEAR code:\\\\n- [`inevents`](https://github.com/INTEARnear/inevents/) is our API framework that is not stable yet, but public API documentation is available at [Intear Docs](https://docs.intear.tech). It\\\\\\'s a framework that can be easily extended with other types of events and be self-hosted. In short, it takes an event schema, event stream from Redis (emitted by some indexer), saves it in a database, and provides HTTP / WebSocket APIs to access historical and realtime data\\\\n- [`inindexer`](https://github.com/INTEARnear/inindexer) - framework for building indexers that handles all boilerplate for you (ctrl-c handlers, continue-on-interrupt, combine receipts into transactions, etc.)\\\\n\\\\nBelow are our products built on top of these 2:\\\\n- [Tearbot](https://t.me/bettearbot) contains open source code of t.me/bettearbot, a bot that has notifications about certain transactions, Near.social / BOS / DAO notifications, near-cli-rs in Telegram, and much more, [partially open source](https://github.com/INTEARnear/Tear)\\\\n- [TPS dashboard](https://tps.intear.tech/) - lightweight TPS tracker that uses `inevents` API as data source, [github](https://github.com/INTEARnear/tps-dashboard)\\\\n- [Trades demo](https://trades-demo.intear.tech/?account=aldor.near) shows historical trades and adds new trades in realtime, using `inevents` API, [github](https://github.com/INTEARnear/trades-demo)\\\\n- [NFT demo](https://nft-demo.intear.tech/) is a fork of https://nft.near.stream/ that uses `inevents`, [github](https://github.com/INTEARnear/nft-mints)\\\\n- [Oracle marketplace](https://github.com/INTEARnear/oracle) that uses yielded execution + `inindexer` to listen for requests. Can potentially do IPFS upload / download, zkfetch with Reclaim Protocol, AI inference, get data from other chains for chain abstraction, and many other. Currently, not maintained, but we have plans to continue its development in October-November.\\\\n- [Redacted explorer](https://explorer.intear.tech/token/wrap.near) - a WIP block explorer built on top of our APIs, [github](https://github.com/redacted-explorer/redacted-explorer-frontend).\\\\n- [Charts](https://codepen.io/Sliman4/pen/jOgOgpz) - TradingView charts that get information about tokens from Intear token APIs (token search + OHLC).\\\\n\\\\n@slimedragon.near\\\\\\'s personal examples of experience:\\\\n- [RPC Selector](https://github.com/Sliman4/rpc-selector) browser extension that redirects all RPC requests to a custom one\\\\n- [Abstraction is inevitable](https://medium.com/@slimedragon/chain-abstraction-8d7dbd110d09) (article that was published before there were docs on docs.near.org)\\\\n\\\\n### In-House Resources;\\\\n\\\\nDesign, BD, Project Management, User Support, Frontend, Backend, QA.\\\\n\\\\n## Body\\\\n\\\\nThis proposal includes this:\\\\n\\\\n1. Open-source indexers in https://github.com/INTEARnear/, are almost done, but they need to be maintained and some minor features have to be added / fixed:\\\\n   - NFT transfer / mint / burn: https://github.com/INTEARnear/nft-indexer. Needs a \\\\\\\"trade\\\\\\\" event for trades on Mintbase, Paras, TradePort, MITTE. There are solutions that index NFT trades, but they don\\\\\\'t work with non-standard custodial exchanges like MITTE, which generates the most NFT volume. This will be done when / if MITTE gets out of beta.\\\\n   - Potlock project / pot donation indexer: https://github.com/INTEARnear/potlock-indexer. Would be nice to support potlock\\\\\\'s \\\\\\\"lists\\\\\\\" feature for custom project registries, but the official frontend doesn\\\\\\'t allow creating lists, and no one is using them, so this is not included in this proposal.\\\\n   - Trade indexer: https://github.com/INTEARnear/trade-indexer. Has different events for fetching events as \\\\\\\"balance changes after tx\\\\\\\", \\\\\\\"one pool at a time\\\\\\\", \\\\\\\"pool change\\\\\\\" (triggered on swaps, liquidity add / remove, anything that triggers state change). Currently supports Ref Finance, ref.hot.tg, Dragonbot, meme.cooking \\\\\\\"staking\\\\\\\" for \\\\\\\"virtual\\\\\\\" tokens, and we were planning to support other DEXes, but it seems they\\\\\\'re not as active, so for now, this indexer doesn\\\\\\'t need any changes.\\\\n   - New token deployment indexer: https://github.com/INTEARnear/new-token-indexer. It supports all NEP-141 tokens (tkn.near, tknx.near, token0.near, and custom contracts), as well as meme.cooking \\\\\\\"virtual\\\\\\\" tokens, but it has to be extended with an ability to detect new NFT contracts.\\\\n   - SocialDB indexer: https://github.com/INTEARnear/socialdb-indexer. Supports notifications, doesn\\\\\\'t support posts, replies, and other non-`index` fields, but doesn\\\\\\'t need to, since near social has their own indexer.\\\\n   - TPS indexer: https://github.com/INTEARnear/tps-indexer. Basic information about every block, such as transaction / receipt count, producer, block time. An API with pagination could be more useful than fetching every block from RPC one by one. This indexer is fully done and doesn\\\\\\'t need changes.\\\\n   - Price indexer: https://github.com/INTEARnear/price-indexer. Calculates prices of different tokens so that realtime or historical information about prices can be retrieved. Providers [Ref](https://indexer.ref.finance/list-token-price)-[compatible](https://prices.intear.tech/list-token-price) interface for fetching prices. It has auto-discovery of new tokens thanks to new token indexer mentioned above, starting to track their prices immediately, and has a [spam list](https://prices.intear.tech/token-spam-list) that is moderated by AI every time a new token comes out (can be useful to wallets and permissionless dapps), [token search](https://prices.intear.tech/token-search?q=intear) with intelligent ranking based on project reputation, full / partial query match, market capitalization, and other factors. It needs to also include the token liquidity into the ranking calculation, add daily / weekly / monthly / total volume, and a lot more small features. Also needs to have an ability to backfill data.\\\\n   - FT indexer: Mint, burn, transfer events, that can be filtered by sender / receiver. Fully implemented.\\\\n   - Transaction indexer: Contains basic information about transactions and receipts, just enough to be able to build a blockchain explorer. Needs a few iterations to see what people want to filter by, but mostly done.\\\\n   - Liquidity indexer: LP add / remove / lock / unlock events, top liquidity holders. Add / remove events are implemented, but locks are not implemented yet.\\\\n   - Aurora transactions, Aurora Cloud appchain transactions, chain signatures, maybe HOT MPC events (TBD, based on demand). Not implemented yet.\\\\n   - Log indexer: https://github.com/INTEARnear/log-indexer. Supports text logs and NEP-297 events, but these types of events are not stored and can\\\\\\'t be accessed using our historical event API due to the volume of logs. This will be fixed if we can afford more storage, and for now we just have the same thing as `near.stream`. It would be a powerful tool that may remove the need for indexers in some apps. For example, some users in our Telegram chat were complaining about Burrow not showing liquidation logs, so we added notifications using realtime logs API. If we could retrieve filtered history of logs for a specific contract + specific event (e.g. \\\\\\\"liquidate\\\\\\\"), that could remove the need for custom dapp indexers entirely. We\\\\\\'re going to make a standard that allows indexing / filtering inside events, not just by \\\\\\\"standard\\\\\\\" / \\\\\\\"event\\\\\\\", that will make some smart contract developers almost never write custom indexers - https://t.me/neardev/57114. The feedback seems to be positive, but we need to figure out a way to scale it, or make it a paid service.\\\\n   - Some of the above have a testnet counterpart, but some don\\\\\\'t. Where applicable, all events should have a testnet version of the event.\\\\n   - This includes maintenance of `inindexer` crate.\\\\n2. HTTP / WebSocket APIs are [already live](https://docs.intear.tech), they\\\\\\'re [somewhat reliable](https://status.intear.tech/), but need some work to become production-ready:\\\\n   - Implement better DDoS protection, rate limiting, improve database performance (the current queries were made as a fast prototype and half of them are not used by anyone in production).\\\\n   - Get better hardware. We estimate that we will need about 20 Tb of storage to sync with mainnet and have enough until the beginning of 2025, with a projection of 5% monthly growth.\\\\n   - Get more user feedback to make the APIs easier to use, especially when it comes to getting both historical and realtime data together.\\\\n   - Synchronize with mainnet from genesis block to include the full history of events.\\\\n   - Upload weekly or daily database dumps so that everyone can extract any data they want.\\\\n   - Auto-generated Typescript library for accessing these APIs (same way as we auto-generate [swagger ui](https://events.intear.tech/query/swagger-ui/)).\\\\n   - This includes maintenance of `inevents` crate.\\\\n   - Service credits equal to the amount of this proposal, that can be spent on private API servers or any other services that are listed in the body of this proposal.\\\\n3. [Tearbot](https://t.me/bettearbot) Telegram bot:\\\\n   - Support of all above mentioned events (where applicable), so that users can receive notifications about all kinds of transactions with flexible and user-friendly filtering options.\\\\n   - `/price`, `/chart` command so that people can see TradingView token charts in Telegram. Currently, the closest alternative that exists in our bot is `/token`.\\\\n   - History of account transactions, token swaps, and other events (basically a mini block explorer in Telegram that covers most popular use cases)\\\\n   - Realtime tracking of all actions of a wallet (outgoing tx, incoming tx, incoming FT / NFT, etc.)\\\\n   - All features included in this proposal will be open-source, and existing private features will gradually become open-source once we reach certain milestones (TBD) of total users.\\\\n\\\\n## Goals / Milestones\\\\n\\\\nThe goal is to:\\\\n- Have all the indexers mentioned above done in 1 month after this proposal is approved\\\\n- Have an improved HTTP / WebSocket API live in 2 months, with at least 99% uptime the first month after the upgrade.\\\\n- Make all APIs and libraries production-ready and stable in 3 months.\\\\n- Release Tearbot features as soon as they\\\\\\'re done, but no later than in 2 months\\\\n- Have everything above documented on docs.intear.tech, with video tutorials where they would be useful\\\\n\\\\n## Metrics\\\\n\\\\nHere are the metrics that will be tracked:\\\\n- Projects using `inindexer` (I\\\\\\'m aware of 2 private codebases that use it on mainnet now, and a few people reached out to me asking about it, but not sure about the current status)\\\\n- Dapps and wallets using HTTP / WebSocket APIs (currently 1 known and a few more unidentified ones)\\\\n- Historical API requests per month (currently it\\\\\\'s around 2,000,000)\\\\n- Users of our Telegram bots (currently about 3,000 total, and hard to tell how many are active because people can just set up the bot once and receive notifications without reconfiguring it ever since)\\\\n\\\\n## Competitor Comparison\\\\n\\\\n- Nearblocks API has more detailed historical data, but doesn\\\\\\'t have high-level \\\\\\\"event\\\\\\\"-like APIs. Also, judging by my own, and other telegram bot developers\\\\\\' experience, Nearblocks API has had consistently less-than-ideal uptime, to the point that Dragon Tech bot had to stop using it in favor of Pikespeak, then switched back for some unknown reason, and in one of the most important moments for the NEAR degen ecosystem, the launch of $CHILL last week, Nearblocks went down for 12 hours straight, and $CHILL closed their telegram chat until the bot starts working. It was resolved by setting up our bot, which had no problems with real-time APIs at that time.\\\\n- Pikespeak API has high-level event data for some events, as well as detailed historical data, but lacks realtime APIs, doesn\\\\\\'t have all events that Intear has, and it\\\\\\'s not as easy to add new ones or self-host the API, since it\\\\\\'s not open-source. For instance, building TPS Indexer + a custom event for [MoreTPS dashboard](https://tps.intear.tech/?round=beta.moretps.near) + and deploying HTTP + WebSocket APIs for these events took less than 1h30m (not including the frontend, which took an additional hour of prompting websim and editing).\\\\n- `indexer.ref.finance` provides token price data, but only for whitelisted tokens, and has rate limits, while our indexer doesn\\\\\\'t have any limits because we cache our responses for a few seconds instead of fetching data from blockchain every time. Not the most precise way, but totally acceptable for 99.99% of use cases.\\\\n- `wss://events.near.stream/ws` provides realtime logs from contracts using WebSocket. Our APIs provide more high-level access to on-chain events that can\\\\\\'t be extracted from logs, such as FT price changes, with custom filters for each. We provide access to arbitrary logs as well, with server-side filtering with \\\\\\\"starts with\\\\\\\", \\\\\\\"ends with\\\\\\\", \\\\\\\"contains\\\\\\\", \\\\\\\"exact match\\\\\\\", \\\\\\\"account id\\\\\\\", \\\\\\\"predecessor id\\\\\\\" filters, as well as NEP-297 parsed logs with \\\\\\\"standard\\\\\\\", \\\\\\\"version_exact\\\\\\\", \\\\\\\"version_semver_compatible\\\\\\\", \\\\\\\"event\\\\\\\", \\\\\\\"account id\\\\\\\", \\\\\\\"predecessor id\\\\\\\" filters, to avoid sending all logs to every user. `events.near.stream` also has server-side filtering, not sure how flexible they are, but I\\\\\\'d say we do the same thing, and there\\\\\\'s not much difference which one to choose, unless you want to extract many historical events, in which case we provide HTTP API.\\\\n- Almost every project maintains their own list of whitelisted and blacklisted (spam) tokens. We have an actively maintained list with free unlimited API usage, automatic spam token flagging using AI, ease of adding a new token through a telegram bot, and various \\\\\\\"tiers\\\\\\\" of reputation - Spam, Unknown, NotFake, Reputable.\\\\n- indexer.xyz and Mintbase provide NFT data, they have much more data than Intear because they specialize in NFTs, so we\\\\\\'re not trying to compete with them.\\\\n- FastNear provides indexers for staking and tokens, but our APIs don\\\\\\'t intersect. In fact, we\\\\\\'re using FastNear for some of the features in our telegram bot Tearbot.\\\\n- Dragon Bot: It\\\\\\'s a trading bot, while our bot is mainly informational, so we\\\\\\'re not competing. By the way, we participated in their trading competition as a memecoin in March.\\\\n- Dragon Tech: It has one feature that is the same as our bot (buy notifications), but our bot has more customizations. As for the other features, the Dragon Tech developer and me have unofficially decided to move in different directions, Dragon Tech will focus on safety (captcha, portal, moderation) while our bot will have blockchain-related features.\\\\n- LNC Watcher Bot: It has only 1 simple feature (logging transactions done to a contract), we have a similar feature (logging logs / events emitted by a contract), but I wouldn\\\\\\'t call that competition.\\\\n- NEAR Lake, FastNear neardata: they are data sources, not indexers.\\\\n- QueryAPI: Also allows indexing blockchain events, but has some disadvantages: 1) Rust is faster and more reliable than javascript (not even typescript), which matters quite a lot when you process 5000 receipts per second, 2) the environment is quite limited, you can\\\\\\'t have heavy state without pulling it from database every block, access external resources, 3) sometimes you may want to self-host to save money (and from what I\\\\\\'ve heard, QueryAPI is definitely not the cheapest service to maintain), to process the whole database locally, use external packages (not sure if it\\\\\\'s possible with QueryAPI), or choose a database that is most efficient for specific types of queries, which is quite important for databases with millions / billions of events. All of these disadvantages are also advantages for certain use cases. Some simple use cases might not even need to have their own indexer and just use our historical log event API.\\\\n\\\\n### Current Market Size\\\\n\\\\nRight now, most dapps don\\\\\\'t have any realtime functionality or indexers. But the UX of pretty much every dapp can be significantly improved if you add realtime updates or transaction history, so almost every dapp is a potential user of our APIs. The biggest dapps (Ref, Burrow) do have their own indexers, but these dapps took years of development and have enough resources to dedicate to this, while new startups struggle to even make an MVP.\\\\n\\\\nAs for the Telegram bot, it already has features that can be of interest to any type of NEAR user: traders, investors, builders, degens, DAOs, and adding a mini block explorer, as well as more events that can be tracked, will increase the market even more.\\\\n\\\\n## Usage & Examples\\\\n\\\\n- `inindexer`: Used by meme.cooking and a few other projects that are not yet on mainnet (or I don\\\\\\'t know project names, just received some DMs from people asking about it).\\\\n- `inevents`: Used only by us, it\\\\\\'s not yet ready for public use and not published on crates.io.\\\\n- APIs: Recently, we started offering private API service, and our [first](https://x.com/Dragon_Tech_Bot/status/1836125531596619869) user is [Dragon Tech](https://t.me/Dragon_Tech_Bot).\\\\n- Tearbot: Used by traders, investors, and degens. The brightest example that is publicly available is probably [DoubleDog launch](https://t.me/intearchat/2485) where our users dominated the market because they had a tool. (the message was posted by me, but by that time, 2 users have already bought). There are lots of these tools on other chains, lack of them on NEAR makes a huge difference in trading / degen / investing experience.\\\\n\\\\n## Budget\\\\n\\\\n### Budget Total\\\\n\\\\n$18,000\\\\n\\\\n### Budget Breakdown\\\\n\\\\nDevelopment: $12,000\\\\n\\\\nHardware: $6,000:\\\\n- One-time set up cost of a bare metal server with 4x 8Tb SSDs: $5,000. Not many service providers offer 20+ Tb of SSD storage on a single instance, so our choice is quite limited. The CPU / RAM requirements for our services are very low (we used to run on a $32/mo VPS until recently), and the SSD storage is not going to have frequent rewrites, so the options we have from cloud service providers are an overkill for our use case (for 20Tb, Hetzner - $1200/mo, AWS cheapest aurora - $2000/mo, AWS cheapest gp3 - $1600/mo, not including egress), so investing in a bare metal server is a better choice that will return the investment in a couple of months.\\\\n- Storage for snapshots and server runtime: $1,000. We acknowledge that during the early stages of adoption, there probably won\\\\\\'t be a huge mission-critical demand for downloading our database snapshots, and they will be chunked by event type (most event types weight less than 1% of the total database size), so there\\\\\\'s no need to spend too much on fast download speeds until it becomes a problem that needs a solution.\\\\n\\\\nDiscussion on GitHub - https://github.com/near/Infrastructure-Working-Group/discussions/156", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "slimedragon.near", "requested_sponsor": "infrastructure-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V1", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "18000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Indexers", "Explorers"]}

{"id": 39, "body": {"name": "Bitte Paymaster", "summary": "The Bitte Paymaster supports any project to fund the gas costs associated with creating a wallet and taking first actions with that wallet such as minting an NFT or voting in a DAO. A more comprehensive explanation can be found here: https://bitteprotocol.substack.com/p/paymaster-a-required-lego-block-for", "category": "Infrastructure Committee", "timeline": {"status": "APPROVED", "kyc_verified": false, "timeline_version": "V1", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "linked_rfp": null, "supervisor": "trechriron71.near", "description": "## About\\\\nCompany: Bitte.ai (Mintbase)\\\\n\\\\nContact: Paul Kuveke paul@mintbase.xyz\\\\n\\\\nSize of team: 14 (10 Engineers) 3 engineers and 1 designer related to this project\\\\n\\\\nThe project is live at https://wallet.bitte.ai/paymaster\\\\n\\\\nhttps://github.com/near/Infrastructure-Working-Group/discussions/157\\\\n\\\\n## Solution\\\\n\\\\nBitte Paymaster allows projects to cover the gas costs for users interacting with apps. This drastically lowers the barrier to entry, making it easier for new users to explore blockchain technology. \\\\n\\\\nBitte Paymaster replaces the deprecated Pagoda relayer to enable projects to onboard new users to the NEAR ecosystem.\\\\n\\\\nBitte Paymaster is live today. This proposal covers one year of maintenance and development of additional features at the request of the NEAR ecosystems. Current users include LNC and Iindyverse for their FKA Twig activation and soon Sweat and Shardog. \\\\n\\\\n## Goals / Milestones\\\\n\\\\nDevelopment of comprehensive documentation and tutorials for onboarding developers.\\\\n\\\\nScaling the paymaster to facilitate millions of transactions a month\\\\n\\\\nDevelopment of a revenue model to reduce dependency on external supoprt\\\\n \\\\n## Metrics\\\\n\\\\nSuccess will be measured by the number of transactions the paymaster facilitates. The key metric will be new users onboarded to near wallets, with secondary measurements around transactions associated with those accounts. \\\\n\\\\n## Budget \\\\nTotal: 78000/yr\\\\n\\\\n### Budget Breakdown\\\\n\\\\nCloud costs for the year are estimated <$1000.\\\\n\\\\n$6500 a month in developer resources. Covers the cost of 2-3 developers responsbile for maintaining, improving, and scaling the paymaster system. \\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "mintbase2.near", "requested_sponsor": "infrastructure-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V1", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "78000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Other"]}

{"id": 47, "body": {"name": "Meteor Wallet Proposal for Big Query and Data Pipelines", "summary": "We propose a simpler, monolithic architecture to process NEAR blockchain data, reducing the complexity and infrastructure costs compared to building a full data pipeline with Databricks. \\\\n\\\\nThe solution will be built on top of NEAR Indexer Framework on a dedicated high-spec server, providing real-time data processing and direct uploads to Google Cloud services.", "category": "Infrastructure Committee", "timeline": {"status": "APPROVED", "kyc_verified": false, "timeline_version": "V1", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "linked_rfp": 4, "supervisor": "trechriron71.near", "description": "**Solution Overview**:\\\\n1. We will run the `near-indexer-framework` on a dedicated server.\\\\n2. The dedicated server will host a PostgreSQL database used to temporarily save data before uploading them to Google Cloud.\\\\n3. Upon receiving a block, we process and save it following the current BigQuery structure.\\\\n4. Every 500 blocks, we will process the data and upload it to BigQuery and Google Cloud Storage in Avro format. We will use a simple job queue system to manage the status of the work.\\\\n5. We will retain data locally for up to 7 days only.\\\\n6. In case the server goes down, we should be able to catch up quickly as long as it hasn\\\\\\'t been 5 epochs.\\\\n7. We will run a Grafana dashboard that visualizes the current status of the server.\\\\n8. At the end of the development and during delivery, we expect to get write access to the current BigQuery dataset and Cloud Storage (or ownership transfer).\\\\n\\\\n**Advantages and Considerations**:\\\\n- Our team is more familiar with the near-indexer-framework and monolithic stack.\\\\n- Given the current block production time and block size, a high-spec server is more than enough to process and upload data to Google Cloud.\\\\n- It is considerably cheaper to use this stack compared to maintaining a Databricks pipeline\\\\n- It costs around **$250** per month to maintain a server versus **$3,000\\\\u{2013}$5,000 or more** per month on a full fledge data pipeline.\\\\n- We capture data more quickly directly from the NEAR core.\\\\n\\\\n**Drawbacks and Limitations:**\\\\n- We are limited to the dedicated server provider\\\\\\'s promised uptime (99.9%).\\\\n- There are more risks and work involved in maintaining our own infrastructure, such as keeping software dependencies updated.\\\\n- Scaling up could be harder and might incur downtime. This can easily be mitigated by using a higher-spec server unless the workload exceeds the server\\\\\\'s capacity.\\\\n- Although this should not happen, during a disaster scenario where the server goes down for more than 2.5 days (5 epochs) and NEAR Core can\\\\\\'t provide us with block data anymore, we will have to devise an alternative plan to recover data for that period.\\\\n\\\\n**Documentation and support**\\\\n- The new repository will be open-source.\\\\n- We will prepare documentation on how to set up and run another instance of the indexer to maintain the data pipeline.\\\\n- We will create a Telegram group and add all stakeholders.\\\\n- For issue support, responses will be provided within 24 hours during workdays and within 48 hours during non-workdays.\\\\n\\\\n**Costs:**\\\\n- Indexer Server\\\\n    - 16 cores / 32 threads @ 4GHz\\\\n    - 128 GB DDR5 RAM\\\\n    - 3 \\\\u{d7} 1.92 TB NVMe SSDs\\\\n    - Approximately **$250 USD** per month\\\\n\\\\n- Google Cloud Infrastructures:\\\\n\\\\t- Only if ownership transfer occurs: Assuming we will be taking over ownership of both Google Cloud BigQuery and Google Cloud Storage objects. These costs are based on the Google Cloud cost calculator and the information we have; please point out if it is inaccurate.\\\\n\\\\n    - BigQuery\\\\n        - Region: us-east1\\\\n        - Maximum slots: 100 (small)\\\\n        - 100 TB storage (current size is 40 TB plus 12 months \\\\u{d7} 4 TB per month, with margin)\\\\n        - Approximately **$5,850 USD** per month\\\\n\\\\n    - Cloud Storage\\\\n        - Region: us-east1\\\\n        - Standard Storage\\\\n        - 100 TB storage (current size is 40 TB plus 12 months \\\\u{d7} 4 TB per month, with margin)\\\\n        - Approximately **$2,050 USD** per month\\\\n        - Upon further understanding the use cases of the Avro pipeline, we can better decide if we want to move some infrequently accessed historical data to a different storage class to further cut costs.\\\\n\\\\n- Team\\\\n\\\\t- 1 senior engineer and 1 intermediate engineer for redundancy (backup and support as needed)\\\\n\\\\t- **$10,000 USD** per month\\\\n\\\\n- Extra Margin\\\\n\\\\t- This amount will only be requested in case unexpected issues arise that are outside the project scope\\\\n\\\\t- **$50,000 USD**\\\\n- **Total budget for 12 months:**\\\\n    - **$3,000 USD** for the indexer server\\\\n    - **$94,800 USD** for google cloud infrastructure\\\\n    - **$120,000 USD** for the team\\\\n    - **$50,000 USD** contingency\\\\n    - **$267,800 USD** in total\\\\n\\\\n**Milestones**\\\\n- Milestone 1: 6 weeks for building the pipeline\\\\n\\\\t- Setting up the indexer and database.\\\\n\\\\t- Converting the current Python scripts into Rust code.\\\\n\\\\t- Deliverables: A BigQuery dataset and Google Cloud Storage that are publicly viewable, following the requirements of the RFP, with initial inaccuracies expected.\\\\n- Milestone 2: 4 weeks for data auditing and quality checks\\\\n\\\\t- We will build a Grafana dashboard (similar to [near lake grafana dashboard](https://nearinc.grafana.net/public-dashboards/773648953bdc423eb5eb6324b89238d8)).\\\\n\\\\t- Deliverables: Accurate BigQuery dataset and Google Cloud Storage, with high accuracy compared to current data, and a Grafana dashboard.\\\\n- Milestone 3: 4 weeks for documentation and integration with at least one partner\\\\n\\\\t- This timeline depends on the requirements of our partners, as we will have only the latest data available at this point, not the full historical data.\\\\n\\\\t- This period also involves running two systems in parallel.\\\\n\\\\t- Deliverables: An integrated system with a partner, and an open-source repository with a simple README.\\\\n- Maintenance Phase\\\\n\\\\t- The remaining time will be dedicated to maintaining the services, updating according to NEP updates, and providing issue support, with no further feature development planned.\\\\n\\\\n**Payment Schedule:**\\\\n- Initial Payment: $25,000 USD upon project commencement.\\\\n- Milestone Payments:\\\\n\\\\t- Upon Milestone 1 Completion: $15,000 USD\\\\n\\\\t- Upon Milestone 2 Completion: $15,000 USD\\\\n\\\\t- Upon Milestone 3 Completion: $15,000 USD\\\\n- Remaining Payments:\\\\n\\\\t- Depending on whether the transfer of ownership of Google Cloud BigQuery and Storage occurs, the remaining balance will be paid in three equal installments in April, June, and August.\\\\n\\\\t\\\\t- In Case of Ownership Transfer: $65,930 USD per installment.\\\\n\\\\t\\\\t- If No Ownership Transfer: $17,670 USD per installment.\\\\n- Contingency Fund:\\\\n\\\\t- The $50,000 USD contingency will only be requested if unforeseen issues arise outside the project scope.\\\\n\\\\n**Team Background**\\\\nThe Meteor Wallet team brings extensive experience with the NEAR Protocol. We are currently developing Meteor Wallet and maintaining MyNearWallet, both of which are integral parts of the NEAR ecosystem. Our team has successfully set up a validator node and is among the validators with the highest number of unique stakers. Additionally, we are building an indexer to provide a better wallet experience, enhancing functionality and user engagement.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nThese are all the details of the proposal. Thank you for taking the time to review it.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "rektdegen.near", "requested_sponsor": "infrastructure-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V1", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "267800", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": []}
